simulateGLV

Source: R/simulateGLV.R
simulateGLV.Rd

Simulates time series with the generalized Lotka-Volterra model and forms a SummarizedExperiment object.

simulateGLV(N, A, b = runif(N), x = runif(N), tend = 1000, norm = FALSE)

Arguments

N

Integer scalar specifying the number of species
A

a interaction matrix
b

Numeric scalar indicating growth rates
x

Numeric scalar indicating initial abundances
tend

Integer scalar indicating timepoints (default: tend = 1000)
norm

Logical scalar TRUE or FALSE, return normalised abundances (proportions in each generation) (default: norm = FALSE)

Value

simulateGLV returns a SummarizedExperiment object

Details

Simulates a community time series using the generalized Lotka-Volterra model, defined as dx/dt = x(b+Ax), where x is the vector of species abundances, A is the interaction matrix and growth_rates the vector of growth rates.

The resulting abundance matrix model is used to construct SummarizedExperiment object.

Examples

row_data <- data.frame(Kingdom = "A",
                    Phylum = rep(c("B1", "B2"), c(500, 500)),
                    Class = rep(c("C1", "C2"), each = 500),
                    ASV = paste0("D", seq_len(1000)),
                    row.names = rownames(paste0("species", seq_len(1000))),
                    stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
                    row_data <- t(row_data)

col_data <- data.frame(sampleID = seq_len(1000),
                    time = as.Date(sample(as.numeric(as.Date('2000-01-01')):
                                as.numeric(as.Date('2014-01-01')), 1000,
                                            replace = TRUE),
                                                    origin = '1970-01-01'),
                    row.names = colnames(paste0("sample", seq_len(1000))),
                    stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

simulateGLV(N = 4, A = powerlawA(n = 4, alpha = 2), tend = 1000)

#> Error in SummarizedExperiment(assays = list(counts = spab), colData = col_data,     rowData = row_data): object 'col_data' not found
